item.name: Galera-Provider version
item.description: The version number of the Galera wsrep provider

item.name: Galera-Apply oooe
item.description: How often writesets have been applied out of order, an indicators of parallelization efficiency.

item.name: Galera-Apply oool
item.description: How often writesets with a higher sequence number were applied before ones with a lower sequence number, implying slow writesets.

item.name: Galera-Cert deps distance
item.description: Average distance between the highest and the lowest sequence numbers that can possibly be applied in parallel, or the potential degree of parallelization.

item.name: Galera-Cluster conf ID
item.description: Total number of cluster membership changes that have taken place.

item.name: Galera-Cluster size
item.description: Number of nodes currently in the cluster.

item.name: Galera-Cluster status
item.description: Cluster component status. Possible values are PRIMARY (primary group configuration, quorum present), NON_PRIMARY (non-primary group configuration, quorum lost) or DISCONNECTED (not connected to group, retrying).

item.name: Galera-Cluster State UUID
item.description: UUID state of the cluster. If it matches the value in wsrep_local_state_uuid, the local and cluster nodes are in sync.

item.name: Galera-Connected
item.description: Whether or not MariaDB is connected to the wsrep provider. Possible values are ON or OFF.

item.name: Galera-Flow control paused
item.description: Time since the most recent status query that was paused due to flow control

item.name: Galera-Flow control received
item.description: Number of FC_PAUSE events received as well as sent since the most recent status query.

item.name: Galera-Flow control sent
item.description: Number of FC_PAUSE events sent since the most recent status query

item.name: Galera-Gcomm UUID
item.description: The UUID assigned to the node.

item.name: Galera-Last commited
item.description: Sequence number of the most recently committed transaction.

item.name: Galera-Local BF aborts
item.description: Total number of local transactions aborted by slave transactions while being executed

item.name: Galera-Local cert failures
item.description: Total number of local transactions that failed the certification test.

item.name: Galera-Local commits
item.description: Total number of local transactions committed on the node.

item.name: Galera-Local index
item.description: The node's index in the cluster. The index is zero-based.

item.name: Galera-Local send queue max
item.description: Maximum length of the send queue since the most recent status query.

item.name: Galera-Local received queue
item.description: Current length of the receive queue, which is the number of writesets waiting to be applied.

item.name: Galera-Local received queue average
item.description: Average length of the receive queue since the most recent status query. If this value is noticeably larger than zero, the node is likely to be overloaded, and cannot apply the writesets as quickly as they arrive, resulting in replication throttling.

item.name: Galera-Local received queue maximum
item.description: Maximum length of the receive queue since the most recent status query

item.name: Galera-Local received queue minimum
item.description: Minimum length of the receive queue since the most recent status query

item.name: Galera-Local replays
item.description: Total number of transaction replays due to asymmetric lock granularity.

item.name: Galera-Local send queue
item.description: Current length of the send queue, which is the number of writesets waiting to be sent.

item.name: Galera-Local send queue average
item.description: Average length of the send queue since the most recent status query. If this value is noticeably larger than zero, there is most likely network throughput or replication throttling issues.

item.name: Galera-Local send queue minimum
item.description: Minimum length of the send queue since the most recent status query

item.name: Galera-Protocol version
item.description: The wsrep protocol version being used.

item.name: Galera-Provider name
item.description: The name of the provider. The default is "Galera".

item.name: Galera-Provider vendor
item.description: The vendor string.

item.name: Galera-Ready
item.description: Whether or not the Galera wsrep provider is ready. Possible values are ON or OFF

item.name: Galera-Received
item.description: Total number of writesets received from other nodes.

item.name: Galera-Received bytes
item.description: Total size in bytes of all writesets received from other nodes.

item.name: Galera-Replicated
item.description: Total number of writesets replicated to other nodes.

item.name: Galera-Replicated bytes
item.description: Total size in bytes of all writesets replicated to other nodes.

item.name: Galera-Thread count
item.description: Total number of wsrep (applier/rollbacker) threads.

trigger.name: Galera-Nodes actives
trigger.description: One of the nodes is down
